docs.lead_paragraph: With the Packers’ Aaron Rodgers set to play Sunday, it will be difficult not to contrast his success with what the Bears’ Jay Cutler has yet to accomplish.
docs.abstract: Aaron Rodgers will return as starting quarterback for Green Bay Packers after missing seven games with fractured collar bone; teams are meeting again and his presence adds a dose of intrigue to what was already a winner-take-all showdown for the NFC North title in the 188th meeting between the NFL’s oldest rivals.

headline.main: Bears’ Cutler to Finish Season in a Rival’s Shadow

docs.snippet: SHAPIRO--Theodore, 84 years old, died on December 25, 2013. Loving husband of Judith (Kreisberg). Devoted father of Kathy Simon (Scott), Hilary Shepard (Tim Brown) and John (Geri). Cherished grandfather of Matti, Alix, Cassidy, Scarlett, Jake, C.J...
docs.lead_paragraph: SHAPIRO--Theodore, 84 years old, died on December 25, 2013. Loving husband of Judith (Kreisberg). Devoted father of Kathy Simon (Scott), Hilary Shepard (Tim Brown) and John (Geri). Cherished grandfather of Matti, Alix, Cassidy, Scarlett, Jake, C.J., and Adam. Beloved brother of Leona Brodner. Also survived by many nieces and nephews. He attended Drake University where he was an avid football player. Then he went into the US Navy where he served in Korea as a frogman. He then attended Brooklyn Law School. He was a member of the US Polo Association, NY Jockey Club and the owner of CIAO.
